response:
<<<api>>>: Java's casting feature
<<<code>>>: To check a cast, you can use the "is" keyword before the cast. For example, instead of casting `values.toArray()` to `V[]`, you can check if it is a `V[]` before assigning it to `array`.
```kotlin
V[] array = (V[]) values.toArray();
if (array instanceof V[]) {
    array = values.toArray((V[]) array);
}
```
Alternatively, you can use the `toArray(V[] array)` overload as follows:
```kotlin
V[] array = new V[values.size()];
for (V value : values) {
    array[array.length] = value;
}
```
This will create a new array of the correct size and copy the values from the `values` collection into it.
